author: adagov.org
title: ₳GOV: URL Conversations
description: ¿Cómo es una buena experiencia de usuario en materia de gobernanza? Las plataformas actuales de DAO están orientadas a introducir contenidos en una plataforma cerrada.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about building a browser extension that brings the community TO online resources, allows them to mark up, comment, and raise flags on content. The problem statement is clear and explained in detail, as a result, the existing background of DAO platforms is quite clarified. The proposed solution is clearly defined, addresses the challenge, may contribute to increasing the development of DAOs on the Cardano ecosystem.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1: This team profile is briefly described, and through the provided link [https://www.adagov.org/], I can see this team's works and achievements. However, for better understanding, the team profile, as well as the member's profile, should be explained more in detail with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. The team got a funded proposal in the prior fund [F4, F5, F6]. The budget is not provided much information [onlytotal budget and items structure of 02 items (seeking funding in F7) but without explanations of calculation base]. The roadmap is provided and described enough for understanding, the only metric is provided, and measurable, fits the given challenge's metrics. Besides, risks are not provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the issues of information delivery and organization in DAO's. The proposer has come up with a good solution to aggregate information by way of a browser extension to members of the DAO
f6_assessments.q1: Yes but only after F8, F9 and $170K. I would like to see some example of what the extension would look like as a working model after F7 and before the $110K F8 request. Given the proposers experience, understanding and continued funding this would suggest good repour with catalyst thus far.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe this proposal has merit and has an established plan. I would however suggest a bit more information on the transition from F7 to F8 funding.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that this proposal could have a great impact for the Cardano Community by reducing the barriers to information and idea sharing among participants in DAOs and working through a web-based extension. However, where I am struggling is that I really have no way to conceptualize what such an extension would look like or how it would work in an operational sense. How would one web extension work for the multitude of diverse projects across the ecosystem? Also, the project has a much wider scope that Cardano so it's unclear whether the effects would be more important within the ecosystem or more broadly across the internet.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, given the plan and experience provided it is extremely challenging to know the feasibility of the project. While the idea is commendable there is not really any information on how the proposers will attempt to develop it. The timeline and key metrics are way too sparse and lack any granularity for voters to gauge. For example, saying "design" in month 1 is very confusing, what is all included here? What steps do you plan to take to design it? Another aspect that is lacking in the feasibility section is how it will be used by the Cardano Community. It's great to say that it will be but there is not indication of how users/DAO's would be onboarded and what that process would look like. I do appreciate the links to the proposers' sites but there are no names or any sort of identification on who the proposers actually are. For these reasons and the difficulties in finding their answers, I neither agree nor disagree with the feasibility of this project.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, the proposers do not lay out how the project could be audited. While they clearly understand the problem and present an interesting solution, it is unclear how the community would be involved or updated on its progress. Also, given that this project is more targeted towards a general audience, it is too hard to discern whether the Cardano community itself would even have a role to play in it's development and potential functionality. In order to improve marks in the next round, if unsuccessful, the proposers could do a better job identifying on and off-ramps for community input and testing.

solution: Construir una extensión del navegador que lleve a la comunidad a los recursos en línea, les permita marcar, comentar y levantar banderas sobre el contenido.
experience: 1 x Ingeniería de Sistemas, 1 x Diseñador de Sistemas Sociales, 1 x PM y (Soficoop) Cooperativa de Desarrollo de Software. Financiado por Adagov F4, F5, F6.
